ygData.subject: Re: Kedge Keep
ygData.msgSnippet: Each group should have a designated EB person.  And that person needs to be *reminded* to be ready to cast EB on people who get ressed back in. Sylly p.s. damn
ygData.messageBody:
Each group should have a designated EB person. And that person needs to be
*reminded* to be ready to cast EB on people who get ressed back in.

Sylly

p.s. damn glad she has fishbone earring! and it's in the first item to loot
slot <g>


----- Original Message -----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 <g4mntofcr@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 07, 2000 5:11 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Kedge Keep


> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> OK speaking from experience here. Our underwater breathing (UB) song does
> not override Enduring Breath (EB). If EB is up and you start singing UB,
EB
> will still be up when you stop singing. However, if you are singing UB
and
> you don't have EB, EB will not stick if someone tries to cast it on you.
> You have to stop UB first in order to get EB to stick. While in Kedge, I
> always have UB memmed. Whenever someone announces EB is dropping, I get
UB
> ready in case they start drowning. Saved a 50 paladin the other night
> because of it. To say the least he was glad I had it ready.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
> Note to Laluni: I'll be in Kedge tonight around 9PM PST if I can get a
ride
> from Ogguk. Hope to see you and the rest of DoH there.
>
>
>
> > Speaking of kedge... any of you know if our water breathing song
overrides
> > enduring breath? In other
> > words. I'd like to keep it memed in case of emergencies, but will it
> > cause everyone else's enduring
> > breath's do fade when the 10 seconds are up?
> >
> > Laluni Songhammer
